solution.text:
let the equation be of the form \(ax^2+bx+c\)
we have been given \( \alpha + \beta = _{{j+k}}_=\frac {-b}a\) and \(\alpha\times \beta = _{{j*k}}_=\frac ca\)
Now if we take a=1, we can get a solution b=_{{-(j+k)}}_ and c=_{{j*k}}_
therefore the equation becomes \(x^2-_{{j+k}}_x+_{{j*k}}_\)

content.text: Sum of the zeros of a quadratic equation _{{j+k}}_ and product of the zeros is _{{j*k}}_. find the corresponding quadratic equation.
